page.title: 14SHIPLEY COUNTRY PARK
page.content: At the bottom of Marlpool housing estate there is a disused railway line. It is now used a a public bridleway. The path is about 1000 metres long. They took the lines up about 30 years ago. The trains ran from the coal pit surface to Ilkeston station. They used ponies to pull the cages to the surface. The Coppice restaurant near Marlpool was a pit manager's house. Down near Osborne's pond the pumping house used to stand. Right down the footpath there's a station under the bridge. The trains they used were steam trains from Nottinghamshire. The land that was used for mining is now Shipley Park. In Shipley Park there is a visitors centre with a range of books and displays by local children. Since it was opened about 400 visitors have been there.It is also a ranger station
